title.rendered: For Teachers – Get Minecraft: Education Edition

content.rendered:
Regards

The following article describes how teachers can obtain and distribute Minecraft: Education Edition. Minecraft: Education Edition is available for all users to try, and qualifying educational institutions can purchase subscriptions directly from the Microsoft Store for Education, through Volume Licensing agreements, and through partner resellers.

To get started, go to https://education.minecraft.net/ “GET STARTED” and select “FIRST STEPS” out.

Try Minecraft: Education Edition for free

Minecraft: Education Edition is available to everyone for free! The free trial version is fully functional but limited by the number of registrations (25 for teachers and 10 for students) before a paid license is required to continue playing.

To learn more and get started, go to https://education.minecraft.net/ “GET STARTED” and select “FIRST STEPS” out.

Purchase Minecraft: Education Edition for teachers and students

Minecraft: Education Edition is licensed through annual subscriptions purchased through the Microsoft Store for Education, through volume licensing agreements, and through partner resellers.

a notice

M:EE is available on many platforms, but all license purchases can only be made through one of the three methods listed above.

As a teacher, you can purchase subscription licenses for you and your students directly from the Microsoft Store for Education, or you can already have access to licenses at your school (through a volume licensing agreement) if you have an Office 365 account.

a notice

If you already have Office 365, you may already have Minecraft: Education Edition licenses for your school! M:EE is included with many volume licensing agreements, but only your school’s administrators can assign and manage these licenses. If you have an Office 365 account, contact your school administration or IT admin before purchasing M:EE directly.

You can purchase individual Minecraft: Education Edition subscriptions for you and other teachers and students directly from the Microsoft Store for Education.

To purchase individual Minecraft: Education Edition subscriptions (db direct purchase):

  1. Sign in to Microsoft Store for Education with your Office 365 account.
  2. Click Minecraft: Education Edition (or search for it using the Store)
  3. click on “Buy”.

a notice

Admins can restrict teachers’ ability to purchase applications from the Microsoft Store for Education. If you don’t have the ability to purchase, contact your school administration or IT administrator.

Distributing Minecraft

After Minecraft: Education Edition licenses are purchased either directly, through a volume licensing agreement, or through a partner reseller, those licenses are added to your Microsoft Store for Education. From there you have three options:

  • You can install the app on your PC.
  • You can assign the app to other users.
  • You can download the app to distribute.

Install for me

You can install the app on your PC. This allows you to work with the app before using it with your students.

  1. Sign in to the Microsoft Store for Education.
  2. click on Administer and then up To install.
  3. click on To install.

Assign to other people

Enter email addresses for the students. Each student will receive an email with a link to install the app. This option is best for older, more tech-savvy students who consistently use the same PC at school.

How to assign the app to other people

  1. Sign in to the Microsoft Store for Education.
  2. click on Administer.
  3. click on invite people.
  4. Enter the name or email address of the student or group you want to assign the app to, then click To assign.

    You can assign the app to students with work or school accounts. If you can’t find the student in question, you can still assign the app if self-service registration is supported for your domain. Students will receive an email with a link to the Microsoft 365 admin center where they create an account and then Minecraft: Education Edition can install. Do you have questions about self-service registration? Please contact your administrator.

How to complete Minecraft installation (for students)

Students will receive an email with a link to install the app on their PC.

  1. click on received appto start the app installs in the Microsoft Store app.
  2. In the Microsoft Store app, click To install.

    After installing the app, students can download Minecraft: Education Edition from the Microsoft Store app at my library Find.

    When the students up my library click, the apps assigned to them will be displayed.

Download for others

Download for others Allows teachers or IT administrators to download packages to install on student PCs. This option installs Minecraft: Education Edition on the PC and allows anyone with a Windows account to use the app on that PC. This option is best for students and shared computers. You should use this option in the following cases:

  • You have administrator rights to install apps on the PC.
  • You want to install this app on each of your students’ Windows 10 PCs (from version 1511).
  • Your students share Windows 10 computers but sign in with their own Windows accounts.

requirements

  • You must have administrator rights for the PC. If you don’t have the right permissions, you won’t be able to install the app.
  • PCs running Minecraft: Education Edition require Windows 10 (version 1511 or later).

Looking for updates

Minecraft: Education Edition will not install if there are pending updates for other apps on the PC. Before installing Minecraft, check for pending Microsoft Store app updates.

How to check for app updates

  1. Launch the Microsoft Store app on the PC (click beginand enter store a).
  2. Click the Account button and then click downloads and updates.

  3. click on Looking for updatesand install any available updates.

  4. Restart the computer before installing Minecraft: Education Edition.

How to download the app for others

You download a ZIP file, extract the files, and use one of the files to install Minecraft: Education Edition on each PC.

  1. Download Minecraft Education Edition.zip. Click on the page Minecraft: Education Edition on the tab Download for others and then up Download.

  2. Extract the files. Locate the ZIP file you downloaded and extract the files. This downloaded location is usually yours Downloads folder “, unless you saved the .zip file to a different location. Right-click the file and select Extract all out.
  3. Save the folder to a USB drive. After extracting the files, save the Minecraft: Education Edition folder to a USB drive or network location that you can access from any PC.
  4. Install the app. Use the USB drive to copy the Minecraft folder to each Windows 10 PC where you want to install Minecraft: Education Edition. Open the folder for Minecraft: Education Edition, right-click InstallMinecraftEducationEdition.bat and then up Execute as administrator.
  5. Run a quick check. The installer will check the PC to make sure it can run Minecraft: Education Edition. If your PC passes this test, the app will be installed automatically.
  6. Reboot the PCs. After the installation is complete, restart each PC. The Minecraft: Education Edition app is now available for all students.

troubleshooting

If you InstallMinecraftEducationEdition.bat running and Minecraft: Education Edition is not available, there can be a number of reasons.

problem Possible Cause solution
The script ran, but the app doesn’t appear to have installed. This can be caused by pending app updates. Check for app updates (see the steps earlier in this topic). Install the updates. Restart the PC. Lead InstallMinecraftEducationEdition.bat off again.
The app will not install. AppLocker is configured and preventing app installations. Contact the IT administrator.
The app will not install. A policy prevents users from installing apps on the PC. Contact the IT administrator.
The script starts but quickly exits. A policy prevents scripts from running on the PC. Contact the IT administrator.
The app is not available to other users. No reboot was performed after installation. If you don’t restart the PC and just switch users, the app won’t be available. Restart the PC. Lead InstallMinecraftEducationEdition.bat off again. If restarting doesn’t solve the problem, contact the IT admin.

If you’re still having trouble installing the app, visit our support page for more help.
